闖.definition: to rush; to charge; to dash; to break through; to temper oneself (through battling hardships)

闖入.definition: to intrude; to charge in; to gate-crash

闖出名堂.definition: to make a name for oneself

闖王.definition: Chuangwang or Roaming King, adopted name of late Ming peasant rebel leader Li Zicheng 李自成 (1605-1645)

闖王陵.definition: mausoleum to the late-Ming peasant rebel leader Li Zicheng 李自成[Li3 Ze4 cheng2], nicknamed Dashing King 闖王|闯王[Chuang3 Wang2]

闖禍.definition: to cause an accident; to make trouble; to get into trouble

闖空門.definition: to break into a house when nobody is home

闖紅燈.definition: to run a red light; failing to stop at a red traffic light; (slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating

闖蕩.definition: to leave home to make one's way in the world; to leave the life one knows to seek success

闖關者.definition: person who crashes through a barrier; gate-crasher
